snippet: A small team at the social media giant is developing the educational software, which is being used in about 30 schools but has much broader ambitions.
abstract: Facebook says it is joining with California charter school network, Summit Public Schools, to develop software that schools can use to help children learn at their own speed; co-founder and chief executive Mark Zuckerberg has expressed interest in education philanthropy.

byline.original: By VINDU GOEL and MOTOKO RICH
byline.contributor: Vindu Goel reported from San Francisco and Motoko Rich from New York.

lead_paragraph: A small team at the social media giant is developing the educational software, which is being used in about 30 schools but has much broader ambitions.

headline.main: Facebook Takes a Step Into Education Software
headline.print_headline: A Facebook Education Initiative Targets Students as Individuals
